active_contexts.statement: Jan 27-28 FOMC: Polymarket snapshot implies no-change as base case (combined 88.5% asof Jan 3).
active_contexts.market_link: Near-term policy odds are a key driver for front-end UST (ZT/ZF) and duration-sensitive equities (ES/NQ); shifts often move USD (DX) and EUR (6E).
active_contexts.notes: Pricing proxy only; watch data/speaker catalysts that reweight tails.

active_contexts.statement: Fed calendar: Jan 28 decision 2:00pm ET; press conference 2:30pm ET (Jan 27-28 meeting).
active_contexts.market_link: Known timing tends to concentrate intraday volatility around statement/presser across ES/NQ and the Treasury complex; USD can react via real-rate moves.
active_contexts.notes: Calendar anchor; market impact depends on policy/communication content.

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs (Reuters).
active_contexts.market_link: Turn-of-year funding dynamics can affect front-end rate pricing and liquidity tone; key question is normalization in early January operations.
active_contexts.notes: Reuters framed as calendar-driven rather than a stress signal.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8 (9-mo low); Germany final 47.0 with export sales cited as a drag (Reuters).
active_contexts.market_link: EU growth softness can weigh global risk tone and support UST duration in risk-off tapes; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).
active_contexts.notes: Final prints; primary transmission is via sentiment/FX rather than direct US macro.

watchlist.statement: FOMC member Paulson scheduled to speak Jan 3 and Jan 4 (local calendar); details not confirmed here.
watchlist.market_link: Without topic text, risk is tape sensitivity in ZT/ZN and equity duration (ES/NQ) via reaction-function framing; USD (DX) can follow.
watchlist.notes: Low confidence until agenda/remarks are confirmed.

watchlist.statement: Prior US cash close imbalances (Jan 2) were large on the buy side (local feed).
watchlist.market_link: Closing-imbalance effects decay quickly; useful for contextualizing late-day ES/NQ volatility and next-session gap sensitivity.

watchlist.statement: Baseline: CPI core y/y ~3.03% (Sep 2025) and PCE core y/y ~2.83% (Sep 2025) in local FRED snapshot.
watchlist.market_link: Inflation baseline anchors real-rate sensitivity in ES/NQ and front-end UST (ZT) when new inflation prints shift the policy path.
watchlist.notes: Timestamped Sep 2025; update when newer CPI/PCE prints are in the snapshot.

headline_memory.headline: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit a record $74.6B on Dec 31 (year-end), per Reuters.
headline_memory.why_sticky: Liquidity/funding context for front-end rate headlines; useful until post-turn normalization is clear.

headline_memory.headline: Eurozone Dec final manufacturing PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export sales weakness highlighted (Reuters).
headline_memory.why_sticky: EU growth softness remains a background risk-tone/FX input for US duration and equity index futures.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Any reaction-function framing (inflation vs growth, patience, financial conditions) can shift front-end pricing and spill into ES/NQ and USD.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Follow-up remarks can clarify nuance; market impact depends on whether commentary differs from recent Fed messaging into the Jan meeting.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Meeting (Decision/Statement; press conference 2:30pm ET)
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Scheduled policy decision; reprices front-end expectations and transmits to equities and USD via real-rate and term-premium changes.

change_log.reason: Refreshed with Reuters record take-up details; kept short TTL focused on post-turn normalization window.
Confirmed Eurozone final 48.8 and Germany final 47.0 via Reuters; kept as mid-priority risk-tone input.
Reconfirmed FOMC Jan 27-28 schedule and 2:00pm ET statement / 2:30pm ET presser via Fed calendar/press release.
Updated Polymarket snapshot metadata (asof Jan 3 17:27Z) while maintaining base-case no-change framing.
